body.name: MITSUMOTO SAKARI 8 inch Japanese Gyuto Chef Knife, Professional Hand Forged Kitchen Chef Knife, 3 Layers 9CR18MOV High Carbon Meat Sushi Knife (Rosewood Handle & Gift Box)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 5 hrs 35 mins
features: [Traditional Japanese Hand Forging] Professional Japanese chef's knife inherits the traditional Japanese hand forging method; combined with advanced technology and materials. Through the knifemaker's manual fine knife shape and pounding out the gorgeous pounding texture; into the perfect forging art and craftsmanship. Insist on completing a perfect kitchen chef's knife through 45 days of hand forging.

[High Quality Cooking Chef Knives] Gyuto chef knife is made of 3 layers of top grade 9CR18MOV high carbon steel with precision quenching and vacuum cold nitrogen treatment. It greatly enhances the characteristics of corrosion resistance, rust prevention and toughness; the hardness is up to 58±2HRC. 2.5mm ultra-thin sharp blade can keep the ideal ripeness of fruits, vegetables in the best condition and meat in the most delicious moment when cutting.

[Solid Rosewood Knife Handle] The Japanese high carbon knife is made of precious summer sourwood wood from Southeast Asia. And features an ergonomically designed octagonal balanced wood handle; minimizing wrist tension and different aspects giving you great flexibility to adjust your cutting angle; while providing a secure, comfortable grip.

[Perfect Cooking Cookware Gift Choice] Japanese knives combine high-end materials and first-class craftsmanship; perfect for home cooks and professional chefs alike. And with professional gift box packaging is the perfect gift for family and friends at Christmas, weddings, birthdays, Father's Day, Mother's Day.

[High Carbon Knives Important Notes] MITSUMOTO SAKARI products pass strict quality audits. If you find any quality problems with the chef's knife, please provide your suggestions to us promptly. Our professional service team will give you a satisfactory answer.
body.description: Professional Japanese Gyuto Chef's Knives Professional chef's knife cuts to keep fruits ideally ripe, vegetables in top condition or meats at their best. It's the perfect assistant in the kitchen. As the kitchen knife is made of high carbon steel to prevent rust, please keep the knife clean and dry after use; if not used for a long time, apply a layer of cooking oil on the blade. Please do not cut bones or hard foods. Please do not slap anything with the blade. Do not cut food on hard objects. Do not touch corrosive and hydrochloric acid substances and keep away from fire. After each use, please wash with water, dry and put in a dry and ventilated place.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: MITSUMOTO SAKARI - A brand that focuses only on making a good chef's knife MITSUMOTO SAKARI is committed to preserving the ancient tradition of hand forging, each exquisite kitchen knife is crafted by knifemakers. We promote the traditional Japanese knife-making techniques and combine them with modern quality materials; creating high-end kitchen knives that meet the needs of both ordinary families and professional chefs. We standardize the production process of Japanese chef knives to each professional knife maker. Strictly following the knife production forging techniques and conducting quality control is what we should pursue. To better convey the concept of Japanese chef knives to every chef. They will become the best assistant in your kitchen!

MITSUMOTO SAKARI 8 inch Professional Japanese Hand Forged Kitchen Knife Professional chef's knife combines the shape of a traditional Western chef's knife with the lightweight design of a Japanese knife for added durability, exquisite cutting ability, and ease of rocking, cutting, slicing and dicing. And polished and forged by a renowned Japanese knifemaker; forged blade with 3 layers of 90CR18MOV composite steel with a hardness of 58±2 HRC; significantly improved sharpness, thinness, edge retention, higher strength and rust resistance. The ergonomically designed mahogany handle and well-balanced, slightly curved blade ensure that knife cutting is easy to keep ripe fruits and vegetables in tip-top shape; while relieving fatigue and finger pain caused by prolonged peeling. The unique hand-forged grain makes the cutting knife feel soft in the hand and helps you enjoy the cooking process.

Package include: Professional chef knife * 1 Knife oil * 1 Tool maintenance instructions * 1 Knife cleaning cloth * 1 Instruction Manual * 1 Professional Japanese Gyuto Chef's Knives Professional chef's knife cuts to keep fruits ideally ripe, vegetables in top condition or meats at their best. It's the perfect assistant in the kitchen. As the kitchen knife is made of high carbon steel to prevent rust, please keep the knife clean and dry after use; if not used for a long time, apply a layer of cooking oil on the blade. Please do not cut bones or hard foods. Please do not slap anything with the blade. Do not cut food on hard objects. Do not touch corrosive and hydrochloric acid substances and keep away from fire. After each use, please wash with water, dry and put in a dry and ventilated place.

Rosewood Knife Handle Rosewood handle makes the entire weight and size of the knife feel quite balanced, and the user will not feel trapped by its weight. It also has good ergonomics and a good grip, minimizing the occurrence of pain and cramps in the fingers after prolonged use. 3-Layer Laminated Steel MITSUMOTO SAKARI chef knives are made of 9CR18MOV alloy with a hardness of 60±2. 3 layers of sandwich steel create a core that adds elegance by increasing stain and corrosion resistance. Sharp Blade The precise forging process makes the steel finer-grained, making it stronger and harder. So blades can be thinner, sharper, and give you a lasting edge. The combination of traditional Japanese forging techniques and high quality steel provides chefs with high quality and reliable knives. Exquisite Gift Box Packaging Professional Japanese chef's knife with a beautifully packaged gift box. The delivery of kitchen cooking knives built with craftsmanship. A great gift for family and friends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super Sharp Knife for a great value!
reviews.reviewText: The knife is made very well and is super sharp and slices everything with ease. A great knife to get for its value, I highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The perfect Japanese chef knife!
reviews.reviewText: I am a professional chef, and this is my first time trying a Japanese chef‘s knife. I was very surprised by the exquisite craftsmanship of this knife. I love to cook and find that there is nothing more rewarding than preparing a fine meal for myself or others. I looked at many knives and was drawn to the forging method and the attention to detail that Mitsumoto Sakari offers. The gift box is top-notch and well made, and comes with a cool red interior packaging. The knife is a beautiful work of art and do its job effectively and effortlessly. I love the feel and weight of it. The blade is very well made and the pattern is true to the sharpening process. The blade is very sharp, and I know I am going to buy more knives from them. I have seen some comments saying they are ”Chinese“. I believe there is a bit of discrimination here, or I don‘t know if these are malicious comments made by other competitors. I have shown this knife to other colleagues and they all praised it as a top quality Japanese chef’s knife. The seller answered all my questions and gave me more advice and information about the knife. Their brand and forging technology originated from a certain traditional forging family in Yokohama, Japan.If you are considering it, get it and be ready to want another one. When you use it, you will realize what an amazing knife this is.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An Impressive Knife
reviews.reviewText: This knife is the whole package. Sharp, beautiful, durable, really great for cutting vegetables which is what I use it for the most. It looks expensive but, is very reasonably priced compared to similar offerings. It looks impressive in it's own wooden case. Nice presentation if giving as a gift. I highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Line cook en
reviews.reviewText: This knife is a great knife for an entry-level into carbon steel/stainless steel knives because it’s very soft and if you use anything abrasive on it, it will scratch but comes out the package sharp. It is very sturdy. It feels great not too heavy not too light and doesn’t feel cheap, it’s wonderful and level knife used it on the line in a kitchen for a week now the black started to come off slightly I can see it fading And it also stains a bit with certain foods, but give it a whip it was fine. I think once keep up with the maintenance of the knife it’s a great knife and should last a long time. haven’t sharpened it yet myself but we’ll see what happens. loving it so far

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It's good, but could be great
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to write the review I wanted to read before buying a Japanese Gyuto but I couldn't find it, so here it is. I'm 25 and would like eventually like to get a bunch a cool knives since I absolutely love cooking as I would use them as a feature in my kitchen. I've had a Kitchen Aid set, which actually pretty good and it's what I'm comparing this to because I feel like its the typical "western" style knife. As you can see, Mitsumoto makes a stunning knife, however it's very thick and top heavy. They could have done a lot better job making it thinner and more balanced. The Kitchen Aid is both thinner and more balanced. It's sharp, yeah, but it isn't any sharper than Kitchen Aid. I already know I'm gonna end up buying a block to sharpen it on. They advertise it as carbon steal, however, that may be inaccurate because the guide that they give you says it's stainless, hmmm... Not sure but I cut an onion and it didn't oxidize 🤷🏻‍♂️ BUT it will impress your friends and looks very good. I think it's a good knife but there is a reason why some Gyuto's cost $170. It's a good way to introduce yourself into the style, but I don't know about the longevity and definitely upset it isn't as balanced, thin, or as light as others out there - thats kinda the whole point of a Gyuto... Take a look at this pictures, like I said I wish this review was out there when I was looking around - hope it helps!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a well crafted and very sharp knife I like it a lot and would highly recommend it to anyone who appreciates fine chef's knives

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I needed.
reviews.reviewText: Not the Cadillac of knives but was exactly what I was looking for. Extremely well made and does the job it's made for. The grip is perfect for my hand. I'm getting old and my other knives wear my hand strength down quickly and my hand hurts for days after doing extensive prep. This knife ended that because it performs well and is well designed. The octagonal handle and the shape of the blade elimates unconfirmed hand positioning i find in European blades. I've cooked professionally for 30 years and I've always wanted a good Japanese blade. This is a mass produced Japanese blade made in China, however it's not a cheap Chinese knockoff. The company is a Japanese company with manufacturing in China. If your looking for authentic hand forged Japanese steel, look elsewhere. If your looking for a well made and beautiful Japanese blade at an affordable price this is the best option I've found on Amazon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super sharp! EXCELLENT for slicing meat!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this knife as an upgrade/replacement for my current collection of kitchen knives that...weren't so great. I took this kirisutke knife out of its fancy display box on Christmas Day of this year to slice/prepare the summer sausage my wife and I received as a gift, and to prepare the ribeye steak strips I would later cook as part of our Christmas dinner. This large, yet nicely balanced knife passed through the sausage and ribeye steak with absolute EASE, without the need to apply much downward pressure. I highly recommend it for all cooking enthusiasts that are looking for superb Japanese steel to put to work in their kitchens!

In terms of the actual knife, it's good. It's absolutely a cheap stamped knife, but for the price you cannot go wrong.I'm familiar with all sorts of kitchen knives, high and low end, and this knife held up just fine. It's really hard to go wrong for 60 CAD. The pros were definitely unpacking it (honestly nicer than any high end knife I've ever purchased), and the handle was very well made and comfortable. Balance was okay, and out of the box it was shaving-sharp.There are a couple of cons. (Absolutely nitpicking from a guy who's experienced with knives) They include blade thickness, blade geometry, and the paint coating.Blade thickness is really quite thick, it's not heavy but it affects the cutting performance, especially near the tip of the knife because it is the same thickness as the heel. The sharpness makes up for this somewhat.The blade geometry is okay, definitely a rocking-intended santoku. The blade has quite an aggressive curve similar to a western knife, so if you use a knife with a push-cut or tap-cut style, definitely look elsewhere as you won't cut through the food all the way. Although if you are comfortable with using a rocking motion, this knife will cut just fine.The black paint on the knife is very slightly chipping, but as it's cosmetic I don't have much problem.Looking for a cheap but sharp knife with flexible geometry? You won't be disappointed at all. There's not much this knife couldn't handle.
Excelente cuchillo, me sorprendió su calidad y aparte su estuche de caja todo muy bien, llegó en excelentes condiciones, lo recomiendo mucho

Purchased three Mitsumoto knives. I own several Japanese knives that are 5 or 6 times the price of this set. In comparison these knives are much better packaged. The center layer of steel is brittle, but thats expected with this type of steel. If you are looking for a knife that you want to abuse and throw in the sink or dishwasher, don’t buy these.I’m extremely impressed with the quality for the price. This steel holds an edge very well and sharpens like a dream using Japanese stones and leather strop.Great value, nice product.

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the best knives I own.
reviews.reviewText: The MITSUMOTO SAKARI 5.5 inch Japanese Hand Forged Paring Knife is an exceptional knife that is perfect for anyone who is passionate about cooking and looking for a high-quality kitchen tool. This paring knife is hand-forged by skilled Japanese artisans using traditional techniques, resulting in a knife that is not only beautiful to look at but also incredibly sharp and durable.One of the standout features of this paring knife is its exceptional balance and ergonomic design, which make it comfortable to hold and use for extended periods without causing fatigue or discomfort. The sharp blade is perfect for precision tasks such as peeling, trimming, and slicing, allowing you to achieve clean and precise cuts every time.Another great feature of this knife is its high-quality construction. The blade is made from high-quality steel, which is incredibly sharp and durable, while the handle is made from a combination of natural wood and resin, providing a comfortable and secure grip.Overall, I was very impressed with the MITSUMOTO SAKARI 5.5 inch Japanese Hand Forged Paring Knife and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a top-quality kitchen knife that is both beautiful and functional. Whether you're a professional chef or a home cook, this knife is sure to become a favorite tool in your kitchen.
My husband’s fav knife! Sharpened with the same brand stone and it’s so sharp!!
